Package hecc_up

Class HeccUpGUI

java.lang.Object
hecc_up.HeccUpGUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
LoggerInterface
public class HeccUpGUI extends Object implements LoggerInterface
This class is basically a GUI for the HECC-UP stuff so a user can actually, y'know, hecc up their stuff.

  • Constructor Details

    • HeccUpGUI

      public HeccUpGUI()
      Constructor with no arguments makes a new JFrame to hold all the other stuff.

    • HeccUpGUI

      private HeccUpGUI​(JFrame frame)
      Constructor sets up GUI frame + shows it Initialises/constructs some other properties of this class including the HeccUpHandler
      Parameters:
      frame - the JFrame that will hold all the HECC-UP GUI stuff.

    • HeccUpGUI

      public HeccUpGUI​(Path heccFilePath, JFrame existingFrame)
      This is the constructor for the HeccUpGUI that will be called by HECC-IT if the 'export' button is pressed instead.
      Parameters:
      heccFilePath - path of the .hecc file in to be exported
      existingFrame - the existing frame that the HECC-UP stuff will be held in.

    • HeccUpGUI

      public HeccUpGUI​(Path heccFilePath, Runnable windowClosedEvent)
      This is the constructor for the HeccUpGUI that will be called by OH-HECC when the 'HECC-UP' button is pressed.
      Parameters:
      heccFilePath - path of the .hecc file in OH-HECC.
      windowClosedEvent - the windowClosedEvent thing that will be added as a listener for this when it closes so OH-HECC knows that this has been closed.

  • Method Details

    • makeTheGui

      private void makeTheGui()
      ok so basically this just makes the GUI

    • setupTheFileChoosers

      private JFileChooser setupTheFileChoosers​(boolean isHeccFileChooser)
      This method sets up both of the JFileChoosers the GUI uses
      Parameters:
      isHeccFileChooser - if true, sets up the hecc file chooser. if false, sets up the output folder chooser
      Returns:
      A JFileChooser, which has been set up with the appropriate configuration

    • selectHeccFileHandler

      private void selectHeccFileHandler​(ActionEvent e)
      This method is called when someone attempts to select an input hecc file. It handles the process of choosing the hecc file.
      Parameters:
      e - so I can use this as a lambda.

    • selectedAHeccFile

      private void selectedAHeccFile​(Path heccFilePath)
      Given a path to a .hecc file, this will save it as the heccFileLocation and update the GUI/internal state of this object accordingly.
      Parameters:
      heccFilePath - the path to the hecc file

    • selectOutputFileHandler

      private void selectOutputFileHandler​(ActionEvent e)
      This method is used when the button to select an output folder is pressed It handles the process of choosing an output folder
      Parameters:
      e - so I can use this as a lambda.

    • selectedAnOutputFolder

      private void selectedAnOutputFolder​(Path outputPath)
      Given a path to an output folder for the heccin game, this will save it as the outputFolderLocation and update the GUI/internal state of this object accordingly.
      Parameters:
      outputPath - the path to the output folder

    • revalidate

      private void revalidate()
      Revalidates and re-packs the guiFrame bottom text

    • heccUpTheGame

      private void heccUpTheGame​(ActionEvent e)
      A version of heccUpTheGame but it's callable as a lambda instead.
      Parameters:
      e - is here so I can call it via lambda.

    • heccUpTheGame

      private void heccUpTheGame()
      Attempts to call the attemptToHeccUpTheGame method of the heccUpHandler object.

      Complains via JOptionPane if user hasn't defined a hecc file and an output folder, or if the .hecc file couldn't be hecced up successfully.

      If it was successful, it gives the user the option of opening it directly in their web browser (and will complain if it was unsuccessful)

    • logInfo

      public void logInfo​(String infoToLog)
      Logs info in the logDisplay JTextArea
      Specified by:
      logInfo in interface LoggerInterface
      Parameters:
      infoToLog - the info what needs logging
